title: package_vignette
text: step reads GCAM output interest alternative file types. Use local GCAM output database Use local project data Use default data (GCAM-USA 7.1 reference) package
code: prj <- ReadGCAM(filetype = 'db',                         input_path = "C:/GODEEP/GCAM7/output",                         db_name = "database_basexdbGCAM-USA_Ref",                         scen_name = "GCAM-USA_Ref", # this needs to match the scenario name specified in the DB                         prj_name = "mydata.dat") # you name it prj <- ReadGCAM(filetype = 'prj',                 input_path = "C:/GODEEP/",                 prj_name = "package.dat") prj <- ReadGCAM(filetype = 'prj',                 input_path = system.file("extdata", package = "GCAMUSAJobs"),                 prj_name = "package.dat")

what: Step2: calculate detailed power generation outcomes
title: package_vignette
text: step queries power generation GCAM output, provides generation capacity operation, calculates implied power generation associated installed capacity, newly added capacity, retired capacity. specific types generation (“activities”) calculated : Capacity operation: running, installed; Capacity addition: additions, add_adj; Capacity retirements: retirements, natural_retire, early_retire, early_ret_adj, ret_adj. “_adj” activities indicate different methods calculation (net vs. total, see Step 4). Please refer documentation (https://github.com/JGCRI/GCAMUSAJobs/blob/paper/docs/tutorials/Documentation_GCAMUSAJobs.docx) details. power generation output annual, broken state, fuel type, technology. step takes 20 seconds execute generate output given scenario. Show subset outcomes
code: EJ_activity <- GCAM_EJ(prj) head(EJ_activity %>% filter(region == "TX", Year == 2050), 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 10 #>    scenario     region subsector        technology   Year Units   value activity #>    <chr>        <chr>  <chr>            <chr>       <dbl> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    #>  1 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_base_storage CSP_base_s…  2050 EJ    8.09e-3 running  #>  2 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_int          CSP_int(dr…  2050 EJ    3.22e-2 running  #>  3 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_int          CSP_int(re…  2050 EJ    3.22e-2 running  #>  4 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_peak         CSP_peak(d…  2050 EJ    9.01e-4 running  #>  5 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_peak         CSP_peak(r…  2050 EJ    9.01e-4 running  #>  6 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_subpeak      CSP_subpea…  2050 EJ    6.96e-3 running  #>  7 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     CSP_subpeak      CSP_subpea…  2050 EJ    6.96e-3 running  #>  8 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     PV_base_storage  PV_base_st…  2050 EJ    1.86e-3 running  #>  9 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     PV_int           PV_int       2050 EJ    4.18e-1 running  #> 10 GCAM-USA_Ref TX     PV_peak          PV_peak      2050 EJ    1.16e-2 running  #> # ℹ 2 more variables: capacity.factor <dbl>, fuel <chr> head(EJ_activity %>% filter(region == "CA", Year == 2050), 10) #> # A tibble: 10 × 10 #>    scenario     region subsector        technology   Year Units   value activity #>    <chr>        <chr>  <chr>            <chr>       <dbl> <chr>   <dbl> <chr>    #>  1 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_base_storage CSP_base_s…  2050 EJ    8.70e-3 running  #>  2 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_int          CSP_int(dr…  2050 EJ    2.79e-2 running  #>  3 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_int          CSP_int(re…  2050 EJ    2.79e-2 running  #>  4 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_peak         CSP_peak(d…  2050 EJ    6.37e-4 running  #>  5 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_peak         CSP_peak(r…  2050 EJ    6.37e-4 running  #>  6 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_subpeak      CSP_subpea…  2050 EJ    4.83e-3 running  #>  7 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     CSP_subpeak      CSP_subpea…  2050 EJ    4.83e-3 running  #>  8 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     PV_base_storage  PV_base_st…  2050 EJ    1.79e-3 running  #>  9 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     PV_int           PV_int       2050 EJ    1.57e-1 running  #> 10 GCAM-USA_Ref CA     PV_peak          PV_peak      2050 EJ    3.57e-3 running  #> # ℹ 2 more variables: capacity.factor <dbl>, fuel <chr>

title: package_vignette
text: step calculates jobs based capacity activity outcome Step 3, providing annual jobs job type, state, fuel type, load segment (base, intermittent, sub-peak, peak). function accepts two arguments: first capacity outcome Step 3, second optional method indicator. Total method used (default), capacity additions pre-mature retirements within region can occur simultaneously technology, jobs calculated capacity activities. Net method, assumes capacity addition pre-mature retirement don’t happen period technology within period, jobs calculated based net capacity changes. Default: use Total method Specify use Total method Specify use Net method Compare outcomes Total Net methods
code: JOB_activity <- GCAM_JOB(GW_activity) JOB_activity2 <- GCAM_JOB(GW_activity, "Total") JOB_activity3 <- GCAM_JOB(GW_activity, "Net") JOB_activity3 %>%    dplyr::rename(Net = value) %>%    dplyr::left_join(JOB_activity %>% dplyr::rename(Total = value),                    by = c("scenario", "region", "Year", "fuel", "subsector", "job", "Units")) %>%    dplyr::filter(region %in% c("CA", "TX"), Year == 2025, subsector == "gas_peak_CC") %>%    dplyr::arrange(region) %>%    head(15) #> # A tibble: 12 × 9 #>    scenario     region  Year fuel  subsector   Units job               Net Total #>    <chr>        <chr>  <dbl> <chr> <chr>       <chr> <chr>           <dbl> <dbl> #>  1 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_fixed           72    72 #>  2 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_var              1     1 #>  3 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_total           73    73 #>  4 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-o…     0     1 #>  5 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-r…     0     1 #>  6 GCAM-USA_Ref CA      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Decommission      102   103 #>  7 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_fixed          177   177 #>  8 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_var              1     1 #>  9 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   OM_total          178   178 #> 10 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-o…     0     3 #> 11 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Construction-r…     0     2 #> 12 GCAM-USA_Ref TX      2025 gas   gas_peak_CC ppl   Decommission      217   221

Running function argument plots employment factors states.  Specifying state interest plots employment factor chosen state.

title: package_vignette
text: step plots annual average capacity fuel activity assumed exist throughout GCAM model timestep (default GCAM uses 5 year steps). Red + Green total capacity operation year, red bars denote capacity operation newly installed given year, green denotes capacity operation built past; Blue bars denote capacity change due retirement. National level  Colorado

title: Tool for project jobs based on GCAM-USA results
text: GCAMUSAJobs aims provide employment projections power sector based GCAM-USA output. Specifically, package developed post-process electric power projections GCAM-USA, enabling estimation future power sector jobs state-level generation technology job type. Currently, GCAM-USA calculate power sector jobs. GCAMUSAJobs extends GCAM-USA functionality (1) estimating power plant capacity levels different activities – operational capacity, capacity addition, retirement; (2) calculating jobs associated activities, including jobs operation maintenance (O&M), construction, decommissioning. Workflow GCAMUSAJobs  GCAMUSAJobs utilizes GCAM-USA annual electricity generation outputs estimate underlying capacity levels based assumptions capacity factors calculate associated power sector jobs based employment factors. employment factor represents average number jobs created per unit power plant activity (e.g., jobs per gigawatt). method widely used relevant literature1,2. GCAMUSAJobs adopts employment factors NREL’s Jobs & Economic Development Impacts (JEDI) model, broadly used literature1,3,4. tool focuses estimating direct jobs power sector, meaning employment directly involved construction, operation, decommissioning power plants, opposed indirect induced jobs broader economy. functionality supports need assessing distributional labor impacts energy system transition. Back Contents

title: Tool for project jobs based on GCAM-USA results
text: Download install: R (https://www.r-project.org/) R studio (https://www.rstudio.com/) Open R studio: Back Contents

Back Contents

title: Tool for project jobs based on GCAM-USA results
text: GCAMUSAJobs, default, works GCAM-USA v7.1, compatible GCAM v6 later versions conditional updated GCAM-USA assumption input (e.g., plant retirement assumptions), package uses three main inputs: GCAM-USA model outputs, GCAM-USA input data assumptions, employment factors JEDI model. details can found . Back Contents
